title: V and E of two point charges

content.question: Isolines of the electric potential due to two point charges, represented by dots, are shown. The point charges have equal magnitudes and unknown signs. If the electric potential is zero at an infinite distance from the charges, which of the following is true about the electric potential <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and the magnitude <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the electric field midway between the charges?

choices.label: <math alttext="V equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="E is not equal to 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V is not equal to 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="E equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="V is not equal to 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="E is not equal to 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="V is not equal to 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="E equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
